summary: "Little Women" is a classic novel by Louisa May Alcott about the March sisters: Meg, Jo, Beth, and Amy. It tells their story as they grow up, from childhood to adulthood. Based on Alcott's own life with her sisters, it's considered semi-autobiographical. The book was very popular when it was first published in two parts in 1868 and 1869, and Alcott later wrote two sequels. The main themes are growing up, finding work, and falling in love. Some people think Alcott created a new type of book, showing the first idea of the "All-American girl" through her characters. It's been made into plays and movies many times.
title: Little Women
